text: Add back test functions for datasets
OK. I have no time for that right now, I'll do it later.

> @GaelVaroquaux do we make smoke tests, tests with phony files or no
> test at all ?

Right now, make smoke tests, and add an issue to make (later) tests with
phony files.

I had to remove dataset fetcher tests because the new API break them. I can make new smoke tests (that will increase code coverage) but it won't be useful... The only way to test the dataset fetchers in real conditions is to create phony dataset files (ie files that mimic the dataset tree) locally, as it has already been done for haxby simple.

Add test for Yeo atlas
OK. I have no time for that right now, I'll do it later.
We need to strive _not_ to have UTF-8 in our code base.

> The problem is that exists and join are use intensively, sometimes with long
> filenames. Using os.path.exists will force me to break some lines. This is

OK. Don't bother. This is minor.
Although this is not part of you PR, there is a horrible camelCase notation, urlOpener, that needs to be changed to url_opener.
Actually, _filter_columns seems broken to me: it returns "filter", but the variable defined inside the function is "filter_".
I'd rather not use an 'import from'. Note that you don't need the "import os.path", as the submodule "path" is imported.
I think that I would prefer to use the 'warnings' module.
A dataset is now partly fetchable in tests. 85% coverage.
